content:
The people who answer questions here, for the most part, are other users volunteering their time (like me), not Thunderbird employees or developers.

As fellow users, we know exactly what you tell us and your recent post simply offers insufficient information about your setup and any error message that might be presented when you attempt to get mail for anyone to offer a meaningful response to your issue.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
If you feel not savvy enough to use the update, then it's unlikely to be a good experience attempting the steps to go back to the old version.

You can make the update look more like the old version, just like you can make the update look even newer than the default you are seeing.

There really isn't anything in the new interface that should be unfamiliar. What is it exactly that has you stumped?
creator: wsmwk

content: Nothing in that error console screen capture is related to SMTP or outgoing mail. The only thing I see related to mail is an error in a pop connection attempt where it is refused due to a network error. I also see a number of lines related to the OWL addon. If you issue is related to an account which is managed with OWL, you will need to address the issues with the addon vendor.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Perhaps a log of the sending process would make what is happening clearer. https://wiki.mozilla.org/MailNews:Logging#Thunderbird_Logging

content: It appears Telstra in their usual clear and concise manner has decided to not allow emails from GMX to be delivered. Why, I have no idea. Perhaps you could ask them. Although this person is not having much luck with the incumbent https://www.mail-archive.com/mailop@mailop.org/msg19803.html
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
I really do not know what happened here, but something totally bizarre. That install is for V78 first offered to channel users on July 17, 2020 and subsequently replaced by a number of stable releases in the ensuing years. I would expect an update at this time to be to version 115.

Mozilla Thunderbird Installation Started: 2023-10-01 22:45:52

â€‹

Installation Details 

 Install Dir: C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Thunderbird  Locale     : en-GB  App Version: 78.6.0  GRE Version: 78.6.0  OS Name    : Windows 10  Target CPU : x86

So I guess you are trying to open and old version. Try downloading Thunderbird again from Thunderbird.net and running the installer. You will not get that message afterwards unless you previously were using a beta or daily developer build. If you do we can fix that as well.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
use Mozilla's pastebin service to post the log.

  1. Go to https://pastebin.mozilla.org/, paste the clipboard by right clicking in the large text area, select paste from the menu, change the retention period to expire in 28 days, use the Paste Snippet button to create a page containing your info, then copy the resulting URL (address) of the page created.
  2. Open a reply to this post, and paste the URL to your troubleshooting information you just copied.
creator: MattAuSupport
